meanings.definition: To be in a state of disorder or confusion.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was wampished after the children's game.
meanings.sent2: Her room always looks wampished after a busy week.
meanings.sent3: The puppy wampished the living room with its toys.
meanings.sent4: The storm wampished the neatly arranged garden.
meanings.sent5: The magician wampished the deck of cards in a blink of an eye.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of disarray or untidiness.
meanings.sent1: The papers on his desk were wampished and scattered.
meanings.sent2: She wampished her hair into a messy bun before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The wind wampished the leaves into a swirling dance.
meanings.sent4: The kids wampished the sandcastle they had built.
meanings.sent5: The artist wampished the colors on the canvas with bold strokes.
